page.title: 06DAIRY FARMING ROUND BOLAM
page.content: In the area South of West Auckland near{Bolam,}the main milking cows are {Holstiens}and{Friesians.}These cows cost between Â£450-Â£800.They are milked twice daily and are fed on hay in Winter and grass in Summer. The milk is first drawn into a glass measuring vessel to record the output of each cow.The milk then flows into the refrigerated bulk farm tank where it is immediately cooled to below 5 degrees C.Every 24 hours the farm is visited by a collection tanker.The driver inspects the milk,checks the temperature and after a sample is taken for subsequent testing, the milk is drawn from the bulk farm tank. The tanker comes at 7_30am and takes the milk to the dairy at{Stonebridge, {Durham City. }
